metadata.title: CVE-2019-11815 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in rds_tcp_kill_sock in net/rds/tcp.c in the Linuxkernel before 5.0.8. There is a race condition leading to a use-after-free,related to net namespace cleanup.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-11815` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.13.0-173-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.13.0-173-generic-lpae - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.13.0-173-lowlatency - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.13.0-173-powerpc-e500 - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.13.0-173-powerpc-e500mc - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.13.0-173-powerpc-smp - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.13.0-173-powerpc64-emb - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.13.0-173-powerpc64-smp - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-unsigned-3.13.0-173-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-unsigned-3.13.0-173-lowlatency - 3.11.0-12.19
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-164-generic - 4.4.0-150.176~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-150.176~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-lowlatency - 4.4.0-150.176~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-150.176~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-150.176~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-150.176~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-150.176~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-164-generic - 4.4.0-150.176~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-164-lowlatency - 4.4.0-150.176~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1054-aws - 4.4.0-1045.48
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.11.0-12.19').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-150.176~14.04.1').
linux-aws package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1045.48').
linux-azure: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'was needed ESM criteria').
